intro: Sebaea pentandra var. burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a follicle containing several elliptical seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
